numlitem.para: It is visually verified that the door is closed and flush with the fuselage before each departure,
It is visually verified that latches are fully extended before each departure,
The door control system is deactivated by an accepted procedure, and
Repairs are made within 30 flight hours.

note.para: The following EICAS message(s) may remain displayed:

numlitem.para: Prior to each departure, ensure nose cargo has been verified closed, latched, locked and the control system deactivated.

placard.para: Placard below Captain’s PFD on P-1-1 panel: "NOSE CARGO DOOR INDICATION INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

note.para: The repetitive inspection required when this item is inoperative must be documented in the Aircraft Log at the prescribed intervals. (Refer to GMM, Chapter 3, Section 6.)

numlitem.para: To verify that the door is closed and flush with the fuselage:
Close the nose cargo door by either Normal or Manual Operation procedures (AMM 52-31-00).
Visually check that the nose cargo door is flush with the fuselage around the entire circumference of the door frame.
To visually verify that latches are fully extended, check that all 16 latches are extended to a position that is within + 0.1 of an inch of the visible end of the bushing (see illustration below).
